message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper presents a neuromorphic cortex simulator designed for simulating large and structurally connected spiking neural networks, which falls under the category of computational neuroscience (cs.NE). The use of FPGAs for hardware implementation suggests a focus on embedded systems (cs.ET). The paper also discusses the abstraction of a neuromorphic architecture into clusters, which could be considered an aspect of computer architecture (cs.AR). The hierarchical communication scheme and programming of memory suggest a focus on system design and control (cs.SY). Finally, the simulation of neural networks and the use of LIF neurons suggests a focus on artificial intelligence and machine learning (cs.AI).
